msContents.summary: This manuscript is a collection of selected portion of various Upaniṣad texts. For instance it contains, first part of the kṛṣṇopaniṣad, verses 80-85 of Yogakuṇḍalyopaniṣad. The second Upaniṣad mentioned as Rudropaniṣad in the manuscript but original title is Rudrahṛdayopaniṣad. Rudropaniṣad is a different text than the Rudrahṛdayopaniṣad. At the beginning after the first guard folio and a folio with some verses regarding Vedānta, followed by a list of the Upaniṣads is given. The list is written in 3 columns. Rarely marginal additions are found.

handNote.desc: Neatly written. Anusvāra is used while writing word patram at the beginning. Otherwise class nasals and sometimes anusvāra used. class nasal is used consistantly while writing the word 'śāntiḥ'.

additions.desc: Table of contents on unnumbered folios at the beginning of the manuscript. Indexing at the beginning mentions names of the upaniṣad and the numbers of folio indicationg the extent of the text. The list is written in 3 columns. But the order in the list and the actual order in the manuscript is different. For example: Patram (column -1) Patram(column -3) 1 - kṛṣṇopaniṣad 1 . 17 atharvaśikhopaniṣad 15 2 rudropaniniṣad 2 18 atharvaṇaśikhopaniṣad 19 3 praṇavopaniṣad 3 19 brahmopaniṣad 20 4 praṇavakuṇḍalyopaniṣad 4 20 kālāgnirudropaniṣad 21 5 rāmarahasyopaniṣad 5 21 śāriropaniṣad 22 6 pañcabrāhmhaṇopaniṣad 27 22 garbhopaniṣad 24 7 yogopaniṣad 7 23 śukarahasyopaniṣad 25 8 dhyānabindūpaniṣad, 5 24 garuḍopaniṣad 26 Patram (column 2). 25. jābālopaniṣad 27 8- tejobindūpaniṣad 9. 9 - bhāvanopaniṣad 10 10.- mahāvākyopaniṣad 13 11 darśanopaniṣad 12 12 nādabindūpaniṣad 18 13 bhikṣukopaniṣad 14 14 gaṇapatyupaniṣad 15 15 dakṣiṇāmurtyopaniṣad 18 16 vāsudevopaniṣad 17
